titles.title: Mobile Telephone Driving Safety Act of 2003
A bill to amend title 23, United States Code, to provide for a prohibition on use of mobile telephones while operating a motor vehicle.
Mobile Telephone Driving Safety Act of 2003

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

bill.summary: Mobile Telephone Driving Safety Act of 2003 - Amends Federal transportation law to direct the Secretary of Transportation to withhold five percent of specified FY 2005 highway funds from any State that has not enacted or is not enforcing a law that prohibits the use of a mobile telephone while operating a motor vehicle, except in case of an emergency or other exceptional circumstance. Increases the withheld amount to ten percent after FY 2005. Allows such a State law to permit the use of a mobile telephone with a device that permits hands-free operation of the telephone if the State determines that such use does not pose a threat to public safety.
